intro: Exacum chironioides, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including white, pink, purple, and blue, making it a popular ornamental plant. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers bright, indirect light.
